definition: decrease in size or wasting away of a body part or tissue, arrested development or loss of a part or organ incidental to the normal development or life of an animal or plant
a wasting away or progressive decline
examples: It was not a solitude of atrophy, of negation, but of perpetual flowering.

definition: to waste away (as from disease or disuse) : to undergo atrophy, to cause (something) to waste away or undergo atrophy, — see also atrophied
examples: Extended periods of weightlessness resulted in body fluids pooling in the upper torso, causing changes in how the heart pumped blood. In addition, muscles began to atrophy, bones lost calcium and mass …
Because of an incomplete spine, only one nerve serviced her legs, causing them to atrophy.
Communion with nature strengthens both body and soul; isolation from nature causes both to atrophy.
When reform becomes too theological, it atrophies some forces even while it galvanizes others.
